body_html:
Thanks, I get it now.

For other Theano users reading this, here is an explanation. In Theano, you build the graph iterating all the way through time, but making sure to set truncate=num_steps in scan(). In TensorFlow, you literally construct the graph for num_steps and pass in data with length equal to num_steps while making sure to initialize the state to the previous iteration's final hidden state.

body:
Thanks, I get it now.

For other Theano users reading this, here is an explanation.  In Theano, you build the graph iterating all the way through time, but making sure to set `truncate=num_steps` in `scan()`.  In TensorFlow, you literally construct the graph for `num_steps` and pass in data with length equal to num_steps while making sure to initialize the state to the previous iteration's final hidden state.
